page.title: 16THE HOP POLE
page.content: This area has relatively few public houses(5 in all).The Hop Pole in Willerby is the most central. Intreview given by the new manager to Darren Watson and David Swales June. The Hop Pole is a large,modern pub where Kingston Road and Gorton road meet.It is owned by Bass Yorkshire Breweries.It has 17 employees.The opening hours are from 11am to 3pm and 6pm to 10.30pm apart from Sundays then its 12pm to 2pm and 7pm to 10.30pm. The most popular drink is Bass Bitter.Bar meals are served at lunch time.Most customers are local people probabaly from 40 to 60 years old.Darts and dominoes are played in the pub. The manager and his wife live on the premises.They have very recently moved from the Haworth Arms and have settled in well.This is a very busy pub.
